meanings.definition: To look at or examine carefully
meanings.sent1: She scoped the painting to see all the details.
meanings.sent2: He scoped the map to find the best route.
meanings.sent3: The detective scoped the crime scene for clues.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scoped the room like a hawk searching for prey.
meanings.sent5: He scoped the document with laser focus.

meanings.definition: To determine the boundaries or limits of something
meanings.sent1: The surveyor scoped the land to mark the property lines.
meanings.sent2: They scoped the area to define the construction zone.
meanings.sent3: The kids scoped the playground to decide where their game would be.
meanings.sent4: His vision scoped the horizon, trying to find the edge of the world.
meanings.sent5: She scoped the garden to see where the fence should go.
